list_definition.definition: to put in some sort of order

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Colin arranged the books in alphabetical order
She arranged the flowers in a vase.

list_definition.definition: to plan or make decisions (about future events)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We have arranged a meeting for next week
I have arranged to meet him tomorrow.

list_definition.definition: to make (a piece of music) suitable for particular voices or instruments

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This piece of music has been arranged for choir and orchestra.

list_ex_of_english: The first step on the road was admittance as an apprentice, arranged through the network.
In galeropygoids and first cassiduloids, phyllopodia became larger and arranged in arcs of three.
Her hair was arranged in a bun with her front hair parted in the middle.
In the fair copy each of the six instruments has its own staff, with the staves arranged in the usual score order.
The experiments were arranged as randomized blocks with four replicates, each containing 12 plants, with four plants per glycinebetaine treatment.
The garnet neoblasts are also arranged in strings that define the foliation and lineation along with titanite.
The planks are arranged horizontally and are rough textured and open jointed.
Clinobeds are arranged in clinothems of dominantly bioclastic, grain-supported deposits.
